docs.text: About this documentation ⚓︎ Our robotic catamaran in 2018 @Hawaii This documentation site represents the architecture and detailed design of the hardware that OUXT is developing for RobotX. It includes not only information that has already been developed, but also is in the conceptual stage. OUXT ⚓︎ We have been participating in the RobotX Challenge since 2014, and we are currently the only team in Japan. The official team website is here . RobotX Challenge ⚓︎ The RobotX Challenge is an international, university-level competition that aims to develop autonomous navigation technology for small boats. Each team is required to develop and install a propulsion system, sensors, computers, communication devices, and other systems necessary for autonomous navigation on a catamaran called WAM-V , which is provided by the competition organizers. Rendering image of an example RobotX course layout. Contents ⚓︎ Home ⚓︎ This page. Architecture ⚓︎ The architecture of the robot for each competition is described. The main components and their connections are shown in figures. For detailed design of each element, refer to the Mechanical Design and Circuit Design pages. Mechanical Design ⚓︎ It contains the design documents, drawings, and manufacturing data of the mechanical systems that have been developed to date. Circuit Design ⚓︎ It contains design documents, circuit diagrams, and manufacturing data for electrical systems that have been developed to date.
